New Records: The Padres tied a single-game MLB postseason record by hitting six home runs, becoming the first team to do so in a road playoff game.
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. hit two home runs.
Jackson Merrill, Xander Bogaerts, David Peralta, and Kyle Higashioka also hit home runs.
Yu Darvish held the Dodgers to one run over seven innings.
Jurickson Profar robbed Mookie Betts of a home run.
Play was halted in the seventh inning due to fans throwing objects onto the field.
Post-Match Reflections: Manny Machado emphasized the importance of staying focused.
Jurickson Profar mentioned that the team gets a fire when incidents like fan disruptions occur.
Xander Bogaerts felt the team got closer after the incident with fans throwing objects.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres secured a split in Los Angeles and will head home for the next two games of the series.
The Padres have a historical edge when a Division Series is tied after two games, with the home team winning 66% of the time.
